intro: Cynoglossospermum diffusum, commonly known as the spreading tongue-seed, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, tongue-shaped seeds, giving it its common name. It is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
